level.text: The Board, in its discretion, may determine the following persons not to be eligible to receive a suppliers' license: A person convicted of a felony who either has not received a pardon or has not been released from parole or probation for at least 5 years; a person who is or has been a professional gambler or gambling promoter; a public officer or employee; or a business in which a person disqualified under provisions of this section is employed or active or in which a person is married to, in a domestic partnership with, or related in the 1st degree of kinship to, such person who has an interest of more than 10 percent in the business.
For the purposes of this section, the term "domestic partnership" shall have the same meaning as provided in § 32-701(4).

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 17-231, designated subsec. (a); in subsec. (a), substituted "married to, in a domestic partnership with," for "married"; and added subsec. (b).
The 2012 amendment by D.C. Law 19-171 added a comma following "kinship to" in (a).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 3-172
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 3-172, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 3-1301.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-171
level.text: Law 19-171, the "Technical Amendments Act of 2012," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-397. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on Mar. 20, 2012, and Apr. 17, 2012, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on May 23, 2012, it was assigned Act No. 19-376 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-171 became effective on Sept. 26, 2012.
